intro: Pachycymbium tubiforme, commonly known as the tubular orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique tubular-shaped flowers, which are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant grows as an epiphyte, often found on trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The orchid's inflorescence consists of several clustered flowers, making it visually striking in its natural habitat.
